link.synopsis: Just out of prep school -- where he was the target of tyrannical bullies -- misfit teen Placid Lake (Ben Lee) yearns to be a regular Joe. When a mishap lands Placid in a body cast for months, he formulates a plan to reinvent himself by donning a suit and taking a job as a drone at an insurance agency. But he soon discovers that conformity isn't what it's cracked up to be in this offbeat Aussie comedy from rookie director Tony McNamara.
link.title: synopsis
All the Way: The Kidnapping of a Music Legend
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: Richard Loncraine directs this offbeat British comedy about a missionary (Michael Palin), the Rev. Charles Fortescue, who makes it his personal calling to save the souls of "ladies of the night" -- a venture financed by the eccentric Lady Ames (Maggie Smith). Soon, the pastor's flock is teeming with prostitutes who have some very unconventional ideas about the path to salvation.
link.title: synopsis
The Favor, the Watch and the Very Big Fish
The Lonely Passion of Judith Hearne
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun

link.synopsis: A botched suicide attempt lands terminally ill Wendell "Sonny" Lawson (Burt Reynolds) in the psych ward, where he meets Marlon Borunki (Dom DeLuise) -- a cheerfully demented patient who's only too happy to help Sonny finish the job. But when he realizes that he wants to live out his remaining few months after all, it may be too late to stop Marlon from "helping" in this wry black comedy also starring Sally Field, Joanne Woodward and Norman Fell.
link.title: synopsis
Take This Job and Shove It
To Be or Not To Be
Flatbed Annie and Sweetie Pie: Lady Truckers

link.synopsis: Michael Sheen and Shirley Henderson star in this sensitive romantic comedy about a man who struggles with Obsessive Compulsive Disorder (OCD) and Tourette's Syndrome. Unable to control his behavior, Mark (Michael Sheen) loses his job, his wife and his home before he finally joins a support group. Feeling less alone in the world, Mark bonds with the quirky members in his therapy sessions and begins a relationship with his group leader, Charlotte.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon

link.synopsis: Brian and Tanya Diggs (Kenny Young and Jill Marie Jones) have a wonderful marriage that's loving, stable -- and excruciatingly boring. That is, until Brian finds himself in an escalating altercation and accidentally kills the other party. Shocked to discover he actually enjoys the art of murder, he confesses his crime to Tanya, and their lives take a decidedly sinister twist. Young also writes and directs this urban tongue-in-cheek comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Keepin' the Faith: Momma's Got a Boyfriend
Love Beat the Hell Outta Me
Five on the Black Hand Side
Jessica Sinclaire's Confessions of a Lonely Wife
Lord, All Men Can't Be Dogs
Don't Touch If You Ain't Prayed 2
Love and Other Four Letter Words
A Good Day to Be Black & Sexy
Diary of a Tired Black Man

link.synopsis: Happy-go-lucky playboy Tom (Patrick Dempsey) finally decides to propose to his best friend, Hannah (Michelle Monaghan), when she returns from a trip. But when she gets home, she announces that she's engaged -- and asks Tom to be in the wedding. Can Tom work his way back into her heart before it's too late? Sydney Pollack and Kadeem Hardison co-star in this whimsical comedy from director Paul Weiland.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie

link.synopsis: In this fizzy romantic comedy, self-made cupid Etienne Pimm (Charles Boyer) sees penniless Duke Gaspard Ducluzeau (Ricardo Montalban) as a perfect match for heiress Millicent Mehaffey (Hope Lange), so he plants chauffeur John Lathrop Davis (Glenn Ford) in Mehaffey's Riviera home to help engineer the hitch. The trouble is, Mehaffey has a different Mr. Right in mind, while Ducluzeau cottons to a certain party -- but it isn't Mr. Pimm's pick.
link.title: synopsis
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Elvis Presley stars as Ted Jackson, a former U.S. Navy frogman who, on his first day as a civilian, starts his new job as a self-employed treasure hunter, setting his sights on a sunken ship -- and on go-go dancer Jo Symington (Dodie Marshall). However, a couple of competing treasure seekers plots to ruin Ted's plans. Fans will dig Elvis's rockin' tunes, underwater action and The King twisted like a human pretzel at a groovy '60s yogafest!
link.title: synopsis
Live a Little, Love a Little
It Happened at the World's Fair
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis
A Guide for the Married Man
A Hard Day's Night: Collector's Series

link.synopsis: Adding a splash of adolescent angst to Shakespeare's "Twelfth Night," this charming romantic comedy follows the efforts of the teenage Viola (Amanda Bynes) to convince the students at her twin brother's boarding school that she's actually, well, her brother (James Kirk). Complications arise when Viola falls for her handsome roommate (Channing Tatum), who's in love with a beautiful girl (Laura Ramsey) who, in turn, is in love with Viola in drag.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Tell Mom the Babysitter's Dead
Bring It On: All or Nothing

link.synopsis: When his mother dies, Muslim business owner and family man Mahmud Nasir (Omid Djalili) uncovers the two biggest surprises of his life: he was adopted as a baby and his birth parents weren't Muslim -- they were Jewish. As he scrambles to get a handle on his existential identity crisis, Mahmud turns to boozy Jewish cab driver Lenny (Richard Schiff) for a little spiritual counsel. Josh Appignanesi directs this indie comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour

link.synopsis: In this family comedy from writer Neil Simon, long-lost father Max Dugan tries to reconnect with his estranged daughter, Nora, who's struggling with single motherhood. But Max's attempts at reconciliation read more like bribery.
link.title: synopsis
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: Kevin Carson (Bow Wow), a young man living in the projects, dreams of having his life changed by winning the lottery -- as do all his neighbors -- but when Kevin finally hits it big, he must keep his good luck secret until he can claim the prize. Thrilled to be in possession of the $370 million ticket, Kevin endeavors to keep his scheming and sometimes hostile neighbors at bay in this uproarious comedy co-starring Ice Cube.
link.title: synopsis
My Big Phat Hip Hop Family
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Mike Epps Presents: Live from Club Nokia
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Beyond the Valley of the Dolls
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Walk Hard: The Dewey Cox Story
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry

link.synopsis: In this raucous romantic comedy, John (Owen Wilson) and his buddy Jeremy (Vince Vaughn) are emotional criminals who know how to use a woman's hopes and dreams for their own carnal gain. And their modus operandi? Crashing weddings. Normally, they meet guests who want to toast the romantic day with a random hook-up. But when John meets Claire (Rachel McAdams), he discovers what true love -- and heartache -- feels like.
link.title: synopsis
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle

link.synopsis: In 1970s England, the Khan children are caught between their strictly traditional Pakistani father (Om Puri) and their more laid-back British mother (Linda Bassett). Stranded somewhere between disco nights and arranged marriages, the young Khans just want to be modern Brits, and their quest leads them to cleverly and humorously avoid their father's restrictions at every turn in director Damien O'Donnell's award-winning comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Priscilla, Queen of the Desert
Empire Records: Remix! Special Fan Edition
The Incredibly True Adventure of 2 Girls in Love

link.synopsis: When a beautiful Mexican housekeeper, Flor (Paz Vega), is hired by a rich Los Angeles family, everyone's life is upended in hilariously zany ways, especially when the parents (Téa Leoni and Adam Sandler) make it their mission to be so welcoming that they become overwhelming. Cultures clash with a mighty clang -- especially when the man of the house is charmed by Flor's beauty -- in this comedy of manners and mayhem directed by James L. Brooks.
link.title: synopsis
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
He's Just Not That Into You
The Adventures of Ma & Pa Kettle: Vol. 1

link.synopsis: Placed in a foster home that doesn't allow pets, 16-year-old Andi (Emma Roberts) and her younger brother, Bruce (Jake T. Austin), turn an abandoned hotel into a home for their dog. Soon other strays arrive, and the hotel becomes a haven for every orphaned canine in town. But the kids have to do some quick thinking to keep the cops off their tails. Lisa Kudrow and Don Cheadle also star in this charming comedy based on a novel by Lois Duncan.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Dolittle: Tail to the Chief

link.synopsis: This comedy follows the exploits of Charlie Bartlett (Anton Yelchin), a miserable high school student who finds a novel way to fit in with his classmates: by pretending to be the school psychiatrist, dispensing advice and the occasional prescription medicine. Charlie's sympathetic ear and ready access to drugs make him popular with the students, but his activities soon attract the unwelcome attention of the school principal (Robert Downey Jr.).
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: William H. Macy stars in this irreverent comedy as a desperate movie producer who lands himself in hot water when the star of his big-budget biopic on British Prime Minister Benjamin Disraeli is kidnapped from the set. Based on Peter Lefcourt's novel of the same name, this outrageous look at the zany world of filmmaking also stars LL Cool J, Meg Ryan and Jason Ritter.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Manhattan divorce attorneys and bitter rivals Audrey (Julianne Moore) and Daniel (Pierce Brosnan) wind up getting hitched after a night of drinking. Disgusted with their actions, the two nonetheless realize they must stay married to retain their prominent careers. Will getting married before falling in love prove to be the secret to staying together? Parker Posey and Michael Sheen co-star in this uncommon courtroom comedy.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
I Don't Know How She Does It
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?

link.synopsis: Hot on the trail of the city's most notorious heroin dealer, father-and-son cops Bill and Jake Peterson (the real-life familial team of Martin and Charlie Sheen) uncover rampant corruption in their own police force. Without knowing whom to trust, the Petersons must work together to bring the criminals to swift justice before a $50 million drug deal goes down. Meanwhile, Jake deals with a troubled marriage and living in his father's shadow.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Disney's song-filled, Oscar-nominated animated comedy follows a lonely Hawaiian girl named Lilo (Daveigh Chase) who's being raised by her older sister, Nani (Tia Carrere), after their parents die -- under the watch of social worker Cobra Bubbles (Ving Rhames). When Lilo adopts a funny-looking dog (Chris Sanders) and names him "Stitch," she doesn't realize her new best friend is a wacky alien created by mad scientist Dr. Jumba (David Ogden Stiers).
link.title: synopsis
Buzz Lightyear of Star Command: The Adventure Begins

link.synopsis: Italian actor-director Roberto Benigni stars as a romantic poet who vows to follow his love (Benigni's real-life wife, Nicoletta Braschi) to the ends of the earth -- even if that means going to Iraq at the dawn of the American invasion. Borrowing a bit from the plot of Benigni's Oscar-winning film Life Is Beautiful, this whimsical comedy presents a world in which all camps are absurd. French actor Jean Reno co-stars.
link.title: synopsis
The Night of the Shooting Stars
I Do: How to Get Married and Stay Single

link.synopsis: First-time filmmaker Abe Schwartz's black-and-white comedy follows three students -- hipster Jessica (Jessica Watkins) and cousins Jenkins (J.R. Lemon) and Lavar (Lionel Sam) -- who meet on Facebook and get together to eat a batch of ridiculously strong pot brownies. Shot in cinéma vérité style in near real-time, the film observes the trio as their initially comical trip turns bad, leading them to wonder what exactly they've ingested.
link.title: synopsis
High: The True Tale of American Marijuana
The Boys and Girls Guide to Getting Down
The Nine Lives of Fritz the Cat
The Union: The Business Behind Getting High
American Drug War: The Last White Hope
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
Everything Will Happen Before You Die

link.synopsis: To punish his cheating wife and save his low-rated talk show from cancellation, TV host Jack West (Kevin Nealon) attempts to pull off an audacious media stunt, which alters the lives of various L.A. locals, including a private eye (Tom Arnold) and a bogus finance guru (Christopher Titus). Directed by Brandon Beckner, this unpredictable showbiz comedy also stars Evan Peters, Nora Zehetner, Kip Pardue and Dulé Hill.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog
Kevin Nealon: Now Hear Me Out!
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: Cher, Olympia Dukakis and screenwriter John Patrick Shanley each won Oscars for their wonderful work in this slice-of-life comedy about the Italian-American denizens of a Brooklyn neighborhood. Cher's an independent-minded widow who falls in love with a one-handed, misfit baker (Nicolas Cage), much to the chagrin of her betrothed (Danny Aiello). With great performances all around, Moonstruck is &NFi;bellisima&NFi_;!
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.title: He's Just Not That Into You

link.synopsis: Lisa Kudrow, Maggie Gyllenhaal, Laura Dern and Jason Ritter star in this offbeat comedy from writer-director Don Roos that gathers a series of connected vignettes about the randomness of love and life. A documentary filmmaker threatens to reveal a woman's long-held secret; a father and his son find out that they're both seeing the same woman; a gay man discovers his partner might (or might not) be the father of their friend's baby; and more.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know

link.synopsis: While falling for a young Southern belle (Evan Rachel Wood), an aging New York City eccentric (Larry David) finds himself caught in a series of bizarre situations involving the girl's parents and his own Greenwich Village group of pals. Written and directed by legendary filmmaker Woody Allen, this romantic comedy also stars Patricia Clarkson, Ed Begley Jr., Michael McKean and Henry Cavill.
link.title: synopsis
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger

link.synopsis: After being convicted for illegal sports betting, former pro athlete Henry Butler (Steve Guttenberg) is sentenced to perform community service at a children's home. Soon, he's reluctantly convinced to coach a boys' soccer team. As he tries to shape the ragtag bunch into a winning club, Butler learns some important life lessons. Sophie Lorain, Ryan Slater and Tyler Hynes co-star in this heartwarming comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Nic and Tristan Go Mega Dega
The Pistol: The Birth of a Legend
And You Thought Your Parents Were Weird

link.synopsis: Molly Shannon stars in this quirky, canine-themed comedy that centers on an upbeat secretary whose life takes a temporary nosedive when her beloved dog suddenly dies. But in an unexpected trick, her pet's tragedy opens her up to transformation.
link.title: synopsis
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: As their lives slowly unravel, three suburbanite women living in Oregon -- Elaine (Jane Curtin), Jane (Susan Saint James) and Louise (Jessica Lange) -- realize they need cash fast and decide to break into the local shopping mall to steal a large clear ball holding thousands of prize dollars. Will their heist alleviate the struggle to raise kids, pay credit card bills and save a business from going under? Robert Scheerer directs this comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

title.regular: How to Beat the High Cost of Living
title.short: How to Beat the High Cost of Living

link.synopsis: On the verge of a game-changing business deal, a divorced dad (Robin Williams) and his womanizing best friend and partner (John Travolta) are thrown for a loop when they're tasked with caring for a rambunctious pair of 6-year-old twins. Helmed by Walt Becker, this family comedy also stars Seth Green, Kelly Preston, Matt Dillon, Rita Wilson and Bernie Mac, in his final big-screen appearance.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: This feature-length animated film (based on Charles Schulz's "Peanuts" comic strip) follows lovable beagle Snoopy as he reconnects with his former owner, Lila, after receiving a letter asking him to visit her in the hospital. With his fine-feathered friend Woodstock in tow -- and without telling anybody -- Snoopy sets off to see the bedridden Lila, leaving Charlie Brown and the rest of the gang behind ... perhaps forever.
link.title: synopsis
It's the Pied Piper, Charlie Brown
You're a Good Sport, Charlie Brown
Lucy Must Be Traded, Charlie Brown
It's the Easter Beagle, Charlie Brown
You're A Good Man, Charlie Brown
Happiness is a Warm Blanket, Charlie Brown
It's the Great Pumpkin, Charlie Brown
Dr. Seuss: Green Eggs and Ham and Other Favorites
The Adventures of Milo and Otis
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
The Land Before Time IX: Journey to Big Water
The Land Before Time X: The Great Longneck Migration

link.synopsis: In this Bollywood spin on Mel Brooks's comedy "The Producers," an accountant (Kunal Khemu) and a ne'er-do-well film producer (Paresh Rawal) hatch a scheme to raise money to finance a movie, while making every effort to ensure that it flops so they may pocket the difference. When the surefire disaster -- which spoofs a mélange of Bollywood hits -- turns out to be a runaway success, the greedy duo must answer to their many investors.
link.title: synopsis
Beats of the Heart: There'll Always Be Stars in the Sky: The Indian Film Music Phenomenon

link.synopsis: An all-star cast heads this slapstick comedy that follows befuddled psychologist Willis Embry (Jeff Daniels), who learns from a dying prisoner where he hid his millions of dollars in stolen loot. Unknown to Willis, two scheming cons also hear the confession. Willis goes to the suburban New Jersey home of Jessie Lodge (Catherine O'Hara) to dig in her basement for the money, while the criminals, who get the wrong address, hold the neighbors hostage.
link.title: synopsis
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: This measured, moody drama chronicles the inner turmoil of a Korean couple on the brink of divorce after the wife declares that she has taken a lover. When inclement weather delays her departure, the pair brood over their failed relationship.
link.title: synopsis
I Really, Really Like You: Vol. 2
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
Save the Last Dance for Me

link.synopsis: While doing time in the Big House, professional quarterback Paul Crewe (Adam Sandler) persuades fellow convict and former gridiron coach Nate Scarborough (Burt Reynolds) to prepare a group of jailbirds for a match against the guards. But Paul, Nate and the rest of the team are in for a little surprise when game time rolls around. Chris Rock, James Cromwell and Michael Irvin co-star in this remake of the hit 1974 comedy.
link.title: synopsis
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
The Fast and the Furious: Tokyo Drift
You Don't Mess with the Zohan
Balls Out: Gary the Tennis Coach

link.synopsis: Singing sensations Alvin and the Chipmunks headline their first feature-length comedy in this family friendly film that finds them meeting their future manager -- a struggling songwriter named Dave Seville (Jason Lee) -- for the first time. David Cross plays a sleazy record executive, with Justin Long, Matthew Gray Gubler and Jesse McCartney providing the speaking voices of Alvin, Simon and Theodore, respectively.
link.title: synopsis
Garfield: A Tail of Two Kitties
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Squeakquel
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Very First Alvin Show
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The Chipettes!
Alvin and the Chipmunks Scare-riffic Double Feature
Alvin and the Chipmunks: The ALVINNN!!! Edition
Alvin and the Chipmunks Go to the Movies: Daytona Jones and the Pearl of Wisdom
Alvin and the Chipettes in Cinderella, Cinderella
Alvin and the Chipmunks Go to the Movies: Star Wreck
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Globehunters: An Around the World in 80 Days Adventure
The Wheels on the Bus: Mango's Big Dog Parade

link.synopsis: When real estate developer Dan Sanders (Brendan Fraser) finalizes plans to level a swath of pristine Oregon forest to make way for a soulless housing subdivision, a band of woodland creatures rises up to throw a monkey wrench into the greedy scheme. Just how much mischief from the furry critters can the businessman take before he calls it quits? Roger Kumble directs this family-friendly, madcap comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Cats & Dogs: The Revenge of Kitty Galore
Free Willy 4: Escape from Pirate's Cove
Diary of a Wimpy Kid: Rodrick Rules
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat
Cloudy with a Chance of Meatballs

link.synopsis: Housewife Marilyn Jordan (Susan Anspach) seems to have everything she could possibly want -- a successful husband, two beautiful children and a palatial house by the sea ... until she meets a group of Yugoslavian immigrants at the airport. Before you can say "unbridled abandon," Marilyn finds herself swept up in a bohemian world of dangerous pleasures and newfound freedom in this surreal black comedy.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
How Much Do You Love Me?
Tie Me Up! Tie Me Down!

link.synopsis: When millionaire wheeler-dealer Edward Lewis (Richard Gere) enters a business contract with Hollywood hooker Vivian Ward (an Oscar-nominated Julia Roberts), he loses his heart in the bargain in this charming romantic comedy. After Edward hires Vivian as his date for a week and gives her a Cinderella makeover, she returns the favor by mellowing the hardnosed tycoon's outlook. Can the poor prostitute and the rich capitalist live happily ever after?
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actor in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy)

link.synopsis: Ex-cop Edwina "Ed" McDonnough (Holly Hunter) and her ex-con husband, H.I. (Nicolas Cage), are devastated when they learn they can't have children. Not to worry: They reckon they'll just "borrow" one of furniture magnate Nathan Arizona's (Trey Wilson) new quintuplets. Featuring oodles of idiosyncratic humor, this kidnapping farce from Joel Coen and Ethan Coen is a deft nod to classic screwball comedy. John Goodman and William Forsythe co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Buffy the Vampire Slayer: The Movie

link.synopsis: Even though he's 35, Alex (Allen Covert) acts more like he's 13, spending his days as the world's oldest video game tester and his evenings developing the next big Xbox game. But he gets kicked out of his apartment and is forced to move in with his grandmother (Doris Roberts). Linda Cardellini, Shirley Jones, David Spade, Rob Schneider and Kevin Nealon co-star in this screwball comedy that lead actor Covert also co-wrote and co-produced.
link.title: synopsis
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Harold and Kumar Go to White Castle
Harold & Kumar Escape from Guantanamo Bay
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy

link.synopsis: This star-studded romantic comedy follows the intersecting lives of several couples as they hazard the ups and downs of pregnancy and impending parenthood. In the process, they discover some important lessons about life and love.
link.title: synopsis
Sex and the City: The Movie

title.regular: What to Expect When You're Expecting
title.short: What to Expect When You're Expecting

link.synopsis: Mark Bamford's thought-provoking comedy explores the ever-present friction between class, race and faith in modern-day South Africa, tracing the intersection of multiple lives. Although her tiny animal shelter is open to all creatures great and small, Kate (Debbie Brown) still can't seem to open her heart to romance. Meanwhile, her employees and clientele (including Eriq Ebouaney, Nthati Moshesh and Morne Visser) are in need of rescue themselves.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Impoverished Jamaican musician Ivan Martin (Jimmy Cliff) wants more out of life, so he moves to the capital city of Kingston. After learning that he's been working for a crooked record producer, Ivan turns to the streets and starts selling marijuana to get by. But he has to keep the cops in his pocket to prevent them from interfering with his business. Ivan's world changes drastically when his business gets raided and violence ensues.
link.title: synopsis
Bob Marley & the Wailers: Catch a Fire
Five on the Black Hand Side
One Love: The Bob Marley All-Star Tribute
Bob Marley & The Wailers: Live at the Rainbow
The Perfume of the Lady in Black
The Man Who Fell to Earth

link.synopsis: Fate and a tenacious 8-year-old boy conspire to unite lovelorn widower Sam Baldwin (Tom Hanks) and unhappily engaged Annie Reed (Meg Ryan) in Nora Ephron's Oscar-nominated romantic comedy, inspired by the 1957 classic An Affair to Remember. When Annie hears Sam and his young son, Jonah (Ross Malinger), on a call-in radio show, she thinks she's found her soul mate. Jonah knows Annie is the one, but convincing his dad could take a little work.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: After his bent for muckraking nets him a job at a glossy Big Apple magazine, boorish British tabloid writer Sidney Young (Simon Pegg) tries to curry favor with his imperious boss (Jeff Bridges) and the synthetic glitterati Sidney covers -- with disastrous results. A co-worker (Kirsten Dunst), a ditsy starlet (Megan Fox) and a dragon-lady publicist (Gillian Anderson) are among those he alienates in this caustic comedy based on Toby Young's memoir.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
Confessions of a Teenage Drama Queen
Miss Pettigrew Lives for a Day
Bucky Larson: Born to be a Star
The Knack...and How to Get It
Sex and the City: The Movie

title.regular: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People
title.short: How to Lose Friends & Alienate People

link.synopsis: It's life in the demimonde when a 21-year-old drifter and her bum fiancé intertwine with other sordid characters (a couple of drug addicts and a pimp) at a low-budget motel in Southern California. Before long, all their lives take an unexpected turn. Christina Ricci, Lolita Davidovich, Timothy Olyphant, Robert Wagner, Olek Krupa, Steven Schub and Patricia Velasquez star as the patchwork of fringe dwellers in this episodic comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Some Folks Call It a Sling Blade
Luke and Brie Are on a First Date

link.synopsis: Skeet Ulrich stars in this comedy as Kevin Manley, a bored city dweller who learns he'll inherit his grandfather's vast fortune if he can finish a 1,000-mile dogsled race across Alaska. Bonnie (Natasha Henstridge), the beautiful, blonde daughter of his grandfather's rival, agrees to help him with the challenge. What Kevin doesn't know is that his bungling lawyer (Leslie Nielsen) is scheming to sabotage them so he can claim the inheritance.
link.title: synopsis
Allan Quatermain and the Temple of Skulls
How to Beat the High Cost of Living
Daddy's Dyin' ... Who's Got the Will?

link.synopsis: In this documentary, &NFi;Cracking the Da Vinci Code&NFi_; author Simon Cox examines Dan Brown's best-selling novel &NFi;The Da Vinci Code&NFi_;, identifying key parts within the text with an eye to cracking Da Vinci's code and uncovering the true story of the Holy Grail.
link.title: synopsis
Mysteries of the Bible: The Bible's Greatest Secrets
Mysteries of the Bible: Archenemy: The Philistines
In Search of History: The Knights Templar
The Mysteries of Angels and Demons
Mysteries of the Bible: Apocalypse: The Puzzle of Revelation
Mysteries of the Bible: The Execution of Jesus
Mysteries of the Bible: Prophets: Soul Catchers
Mysteries of the Bible: Abraham: One Man, One God
Ancient Mysteries: The Quest for the Fountain of Youth
History's Mysteries: Cliff Mummies of the Andes
Ancient Mysteries: The Sacred Waters of Lourdes
National Geographic: Secrets of Jerusalem's Holiest Sites
Ancient Mysteries: Lost Castles of England
National Geographic: The Gospel of Judas
Ancient Mysteries: Forbidden City: Dynasty and Destiny
History's Mysteries: True Story of Rasputin
2012: Mayan Prophecy and the Shift of the Ages
History's Mysteries: The Knights of Camelot
Ancient Mysteries: Astrology: Secrets in the Stars
National Geographic: Into the Great Pyramid
Christopher Columbus: Explorer of the New World
History's Mysteries: The Wright Brothers Controversy

link.synopsis: Based on the novel by Carol Shields, this comedy charts the relationship of the unlikeliest of couples, Tom and Fay (Bruce Greenwood and Emilia Fox). He's a thrice-divorced talk show host, susceptible to jumping into love. She's an overly cautious academic whose impossible expectations for a mate have hindered her romantic life. Despite their seeming incompatibility, the two soon fall in love and discover that the heart knows no rules.
link.title: synopsis
I Love You, Don't Touch Me

link.synopsis: In this outstanding independent comedy, down-and-out restaurateur Dave Purcell (William Hurt) is ready to close his doors, until his friend Alphonse devises a wacky plan. They fake a sighting of a rare bird, and soon the place is filled with bird watchers, famous folks and a potential love interest. But Alphonse has another not-so-benign scheme that could put Dave behind bars and close the restaurant for good.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Geeky teenager David (Tobey Maguire) and his popular twin  sister, Jennifer (Reese Witherspoon), get sucked into the black-and-white world of a 1950s TV sitcom called "Pleasantville," and find a world where everything is peachy keen all the time. But when Jennifer's modern attitude disrupts Pleasantville's peaceful but boring routine, she literally brings color into its life. Gary Ross directs this Oscar-nominated comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Girl Who Leapt Through Time
InuYasha: The Movie 3: Swords of an Honorable Ruler

link.synopsis: Spunky auto mechanic Tomasina "Tommy" Boyd (Betsy Russell) won't let herself love a man -- until she falls for dreamy race-car driver Randy Starr (Gerard Christopher). But when she squares off against Randy on the track, will the battle derail their romance? Directed by Herb Freed, this 1980s sex comedy also stars Kristi Somers and Eric Douglas as the spoiled rich boy in charge of Randy's racing team.
link.title: synopsis
The Virgin Queen of St. Francis High
Take This Job and Shove It
Eddie and the Cruisers II: Eddie Lives

link.synopsis: This music-filled episode of "The Colgate Comedy Hour" follows the riotous escapades aboard a luxury liner as a brassy nightclub singer bound for a titled husband in England gets mixed up with her still-devoted ex and a gangster posing as a cleric.
link.title: synopsis
The Frank Sinatra Show with Ella Fitzgerald
There's No Business Like Show Business
How to Succeed in Business Without Really Trying
Tony Bennett: The Music Never Ends
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend

link.synopsis: &NFb;&NFb_;This quirky comedy stars Kylie Sparks and Ethan Embry as misfits who bond during a one-night suburban odyssey. When nobody except her mom and imaginary friend show up at her 18th birthday bash, chubby Cara (Sparks) strikes up a conversation with philosophizing pizza deliveryman Matt Firenze (Embry) -- who invites her to tag along on his rounds. What ensues is a revelatory evening that gives Cara an education and forces Matt to face reality.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Cass Brown (Gary Cooper) is about to marry for the second time; his first marriage, to Isabel (Teresa Wright), was annulled. But when he discovers that Isabel just had their baby, Cass kidnaps the infant to keep her from being adopted. Isabel's parents hunt for the child and discover that Cass and Isabel are still hopelessly in love. Patricia Collinge and Edmund Breon co-star in this classic comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee
category.term: Best Art Direction Black and White nominee

link.title: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
I Was a Male War Bride
The Strange Affair of Uncle Harry
The Last Time I Saw Paris
The Man in the White Suit
There's No Business Like Show Business
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Smooth and sexy Alex "Hitch" Hitchens (Will Smith) is the master of seduction in this charming romantic comedy. His specialty? Helping clueless clients make a great first impression so they not only get to the second date, but make someone fall for them. When a gossip reporter (Eva Mendes) starts nosing around his business, however, Hitch finds himself out of moves as he forgets all his lessons and has to figure out a whole new strategy to love.
link.title: synopsis
How to Lose a Guy in 10 Days
The Cutting Edge: Going for the Gold

link.synopsis: Will Smith stars as Hancock, a down-and-out superhero who's forced to employ a PR expert (Jason Bateman) to help repair his image when the public grows weary of all the damage he's inflicted during his lifesaving heroics. The agent's idea of imprisoning the antihero to make the world miss him proves successful, but will Hancock stick to his new sense of purpose or slip back into old habits? Charlize Theron co-stars in Peter Berg's action-comedy.
link.title: synopsis
You Don't Mess with the Zohan

link.synopsis: In this offbeat existential comedy from director Harold Ramis, self-centered television weatherman Phil Connors (Bill Murray) is sent to Punxsutawney, Pa., to cover the annual appearance of the town's world-famous groundhog. After unleashing his bitterness on his producer (Andie MacDowell) and cameraman (Chris Elliott), Connors realizes he's doomed to repeat Groundhog Day until he learns that his actions can affect the outcome.
link.title: synopsis
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Back to the Future Part III

link.synopsis: When her doctor gives her the worst possible news -- that she has a terminal illness -- a timid woman (Queen Latifah) decides to throw caution to the wind, break out of her shell and take a no-holds-barred European vacation. But while she's celebrating her last hurrah, she touches the lives of everyone around her. LL Cool J, Timothy Hutton, Gerard Depardieu, Alicia Witt and Giancarlo Esposito co-star in Wayne Wang's life-affirming comedy.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Mad Black Woman
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Dim Sum: A Little Bit of Heart
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School

link.synopsis: In this off-the-wall indie comedy, a middle-aged car salesman gets much more than he bargained for when he offers a shapely young beauty a ride to her desert mobile home -- and finds a corpse in his trunk the next morning.
link.title: synopsis
A Woman, Her Men and Her Futon
Red Shoe Diaries: The Movie: Special Edition

link.synopsis: Jerry Seinfeld stars in this animated comedy as recent college grad Barry B. Benson, a worker bee stuck in a dead-end job making honey who files a lawsuit against humans when he learns they've been stealing bees' nectar all along. Co-written by Seinfeld, the film features an all-star voice cast, including Renée Zellweger, John Goodman, Matthew Broderick and Chris Rock, as well as "Seinfeld" alumni Michael Richards and Patrick Warburton.
link.title: synopsis
Dr. Seuss' The Cat in the Hat

link.synopsis: Seventeen-year-old Leon Bronstein (Jay Baruchel) thinks he is the reincarnation of Russian October Revolution leader Leon Trotsky, thus staging a strike at his father's (Saul Rubinek) factory and then a student walkout at his new school. Film legend Geneviève Bujold appears as the head of the school board in writer-director Jacob Tierney's "revolting" comedy. Emily Hampshire, Justin Bradley, Kaniehtiio Horn and Jesse Rath also co-star.
link.title: synopsis
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand

link.synopsis: To jump-start his career, wannabe journalist Dan (Luke Treadaway) sets out to write a juicy exposé on dogging, the practice of sleeping with strangers in parking lots. While researching the story, Dan falls for a curious co-ed (Kate Heppell) and struggles to overcome his hang-ups. This naughty British comedy co-stars Sammy T. Dobson as Dan's longtime girlfriend, Tanya, and Richard Riddell as his bed-hopping flatmate, Rob.
link.title: synopsis
Don't Let Me Die on a Sunday
Private Practices: The Story of a Sex Surrogate
Starz Inside: Sex and the Cinema

link.synopsis: Siblings Jay and Mark Duplass direct this stoner comedy focusing on two brothers -- one a moderate success, the other still living with Mom. A trip to the store for glue, however, turns into an encounter with destiny for the stay-at-home slacker.
link.title: synopsis
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
You Will Meet a Tall Dark Stranger
Did You Hear About the Morgans?

link.synopsis: Abbott and Costello wind up on the wrong side of the law in their final film together. Kiddieland owner Lou (Lou Costello) becomes a suspect when the D.A. investigating the gambling debts owed by Lou's pal Bud (Bud Abbott) is killed. Toss in some angry mobsters and social workers who threaten to take Lou's two adopted kids away, and it's one wild ride at the amusement park as the slapstick-comedy duo tries to stay one step ahead of trouble.
link.title: synopsis
Marx Brothers: Inside the Marx Brothers
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!

link.synopsis: Dean Martin pours on the charm as hunky actor Jason Steel in this romantic comedy directed by Daniel Mann. When Steel is mistaken for the doctor he plays on TV, he finds himself providing sage advice to a bevy of married ladies. While their husbands are engaged in a weekly Wednesday night poker game, Steel must fend off the wives' advances while he keeps up the charade. Comic legend Carol Burnett delivers one-liners as Steel's secretary.
link.title: synopsis
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
How to Stuff a Wild Bikini
If It's Tuesday, This Must Be Belgium
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Frank Sinatra Show: Welcome Home Elvis

title.regular: Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
title.short: Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?

link.synopsis: Upset that his father doesn't spend enough time with him, 11-year-old computer whiz Matt Tyler (Michael Angarano) enlists the help of his sister Kelly (Vanessa Zima) and friend Danny (Kevin Jamal Woods) in trading online stock -- until he buys enough to take over dad's (Kevin Kilner) toy company. But Matt soon learns that running a company is a little harder than he expected! Rich Little and Dom DeLuise co-star in this fun family comedy.
link.title: synopsis
When Zachary Beaver Came to Town
The Adventures of Jimmy Neutron: Boy Genius
Phineas and Ferb: Across the Second Dimension
Lady and the Tramp II: Scamp's Adventure
The Neverending Story 3: Escape From Fantasia
Stuart Little 3: Call of the Wild

link.synopsis: When a call girl witnesses a gangland hit, she becomes the mob's next target, and the only people who can save her are mismatched cops Danny Tyler (Don "The Dragon" Wilson) and Phil Yordan (Olivier Gruner). The pair quickly become targets as well, and all three are soon on the run. But is one of them secretly tipping off their pursuers? That's what each member of the trio begins to wonder as they narrowly escape extermination time and again.
link.title: synopsis
Live Like a Cop, Die Like a Man

link.synopsis: Adrienne Shelly directs and co-stars in this offbeat comedy about Bill (Reg Rogers), a man whose wife just ran off with his best friend. Trying to help, Bill's sister sets him up with Bernice (Ally Sheedy), an odd woman who takes their blind date in an unsettling direction. While Bill tries to make it clear that Bernice isn't his type, she grows increasingly obsessive and forces him to take a bizarre journey with her.
link.title: synopsis
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: Trendsetting 12-year-old Annie Lamm (Jordan-Claire Green) must adapt to a completely different scene when she's coerced to leave New York City and spend the summer in Hilton Head, South Carolina, with her Grandpa Donald (Paul Dooley). The two get off to a rocky start, but with the guidance of a new friend (Gregg Russell), Annie grows close to her aging grandpa. Leah Thompson, Martin Mull, Thomas Gibson, David Keith and Sonya Eddy also star.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: In this valentine to modern romance, book superstore magnate Joe Fox (Tom Hanks) and independent book shop owner Kathleen Kelly (Meg Ryan) fall in love in the anonymity of the Internet -- both blissfully unaware that he's trying to put her out of business. Director Nora Ephron's Golden Globe-nominated romantic comedy puts romance on the ropes -- and forces two people to make tough decisions about life, love and livelihood.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.synopsis: Academy Award winner Reese Witherspoon teams up with Vince Vaughn for this romantic comedy that casts them as a dating couple who are forced to spend their first Christmas together visiting each of their four divorced parents -- in a single day. Seth Gordon directs an all-star cast that includes Robert Duvall, Sissy Spacek, Mary Steenburgen, Dwight Yoakam, Carol Kane, Jon Favreau and Tim McGraw.
link.title: synopsis
National Lampoon's Christmas Vacation 2: Cousin Eddie's Island Adventure
Me and You and Everyone We Know
Dios los Junta y Ellos Se Separan
Down and Out in Beverly Hills
Vince Vaughn's Wild West Comedy Show
He's Just Not That Into You

link.synopsis: Based on the "Saturday Night Live" sketch, this action-packed comedy stars Will Forte as incompetent former special ops agent MacGruber. When he's called back into action to deactivate archenemy Dieter Von Cunth (Val Kilmer), MacGruber is on the case. Now, he must thwart Von Cunth's plans to destroy Washington, D.C., with a nuclear warhead. Kristen Wiig, Ryan Phillippe, Maya Rudolph and Powers Boothe co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Naked Ambition: An R-Rated Look at an X-Rated Industry
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
The Drawn Together Movie: The Movie!
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Meet the Spartans: Unrated Pit of Death Edition
Trailer Park Boys: Countdown to Liquor Day
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Austin Powers: International Man of Mystery
Shriek If You Know What I Did Last Friday the 13th

link.synopsis: Set in 1910 during the uprising of Medero's forces against the Profirio Diaz command, El Cometa is the story of love, war and the cinema. Romualdo runs a variety show that just lost its biggest star, his son Victor (Diego Luna), to the lure of the cinema and cinematographer Guy (Patrick LeMauff). Guy agrees to help Romualdo get his act back on track in exchange for harboring Valentina (Ana Claudia Talancon), the daughter of a Medero rebel.
link.title: synopsis
Vidas Privadas / Pantaleon Y Las Visitadores
El Coronel No Tiene Quien Le Escriba

link.synopsis: Comedians Jill-Michele Melean, Carlos Oscar, Luke Torrez and Cain Lopez headline this side-splitting stand-up comedy concert featuring the Latino rising stars who are making a name for themselves onstage and offstage. The material is fresh and edgy, the timing razor sharp and the laughter plentiful as they dish out their own particular brand of humor and whip fans into a "loco" frenzy with style and panache.
link.title: synopsis
Macho Men and the Women Who Love Them
Carlos Mencia: No Strings Attached: Live, Extended and Uncensored
Comedy Express: B.T.: I'm Not Black Enough
The Gospel Comedy All-Stars 3:  Don't Judge Me!
Beats of the Heart: Salsa: Latin Pop Music in the Cities
Mo'Nique: I Coulda Been Your Cellmate!
The Comedians of Comedy: Live at the El Rey
Steve Harvey: Don't Trip, He Ain't Through with Me Yet
The Axis of Evil Comedy Tour
Young & Handsome: An Evening with Jeff Garlin
Dana Gould: Let Me Put My Thoughts In You
Jamie Kennedy: Unwashed: The Stand-Up Special
Jamie Foxx: I Might Need Security
Charlie Murphy: I Will Not Apologize
Bob & Tom: Comedy All Stars Tour
Patrice O'Neal: Elephant in the Room
Jo Koy: Don't Make Him Angry
Janeane Garofalo: If You Will: Live in Seattle

link.synopsis: Having just weaned himself off antidepressants, Andrew Largeman (Zach Braff, who also directs) returns to his New Jersey hometown after a decade away to attend his mother's funeral and slowly begins to see his life in a new light. In the process, he confronts his psychologist father (Ian Holm) and forges a connection with a new friend (Natalie Portman). This whimsical comedy premiered at the 2004 Sundance Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
Eternal Sunshine of the Spotless Mind

link.synopsis: Alfred Hitchcock's second American comedy demonstrates the director's flair for gallows humor. The trouble with Harry is ... he's "expired," and the residents of a quaint New England tourist spot just can't seem to get rid of him. Shirley MacLaine makes her film debut, and that's Jerry Mathers (the Beave himself) as the bewildered boy. See if you can spot Hitchcock in his customary cameo (hint: he's strolling past a limo).
link.title: synopsis
The Man Who Knew Too Much
Orson Welles: The Stranger/Orson Welles on Film
Sherlock Holmes and the Secret Weapon
Sherlock Holmes: The Woman in Green

link.synopsis: Three rookie teachers and one unenthusiastic assistant principal face a rambunctious student body, a cantankerous set of colleagues, embarrassing rumors, equipment malfunctions and various absurdities at Harrison High, a typically provocative and volatile (although fictional) public school in Austin, Texas. The documentary-style comedy won several awards, including Outstanding Performance by an Ensemble Cast at the 2006 Los Angeles Film Festival.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle

link.synopsis: With San Francisco debutante Jessica Poole (Debbie Reynolds) preparing to marry a Napa Valley cattle rancher (Tab Hunter), her prodigal playboy father, Biddeford "Pogo" Poole (Fred Astaire), decides to reintroduce himself into the family fold. But just what exactly are his intentions? Oozing charm, he wastes no time in showing up his far less sophisticated future son-in-law in an attempt to win back his daughter's affections.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Who's Been Sleeping in My Bed?
I Was a Male War Bride
There's No Business Like Show Business
Boy, Did I Get a Wrong Number!
The Last Time I Saw Paris

link.synopsis: Between trying to get Judy Bee (Elaine Hendrix) back and tracking down a sexy client's stalker, droll Det. Rock Slyde (Patrick Warburton) has his hands full in this comedy that also stars Rena Sofer and includes cameos by Jason Alexander, Brian Bosworth and Jerry Cantrell. Andy Dick plays a wigged-out cult leader who has successfully brainwashed Judy. Chris Dowling (The Plight of Clownana) writes and directs.
link.title: synopsis
A Film with Me in It
How to Be a Serial Killer
The Last Lovecraft: Relic of Cthulhu

link.synopsis: Burt Reynolds plays Ed Earl Dodd, a sheriff who's more interested in keeping open his town's most popular business -- the "Chicken Ranch," a notorious Texas whorehouse -- than in carrying out the letter of the law. Dolly Parton is Mona Stangely, the whorehouse madam who also happens to hold the sheriff's interest. Together, they battle publicity-seeking politicians and the Moral Majority to save the whorehouse in this rollicking musical comedy.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Actress in a Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

category.label: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee
category.term: Best Motion Picture (Musical or Comedy) nominee

link.title: Take This Job and Shove It

title.regular: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas
title.short: The Best Little Whorehouse in Texas

link.synopsis: Actor and playwright Tyler Perry reprises his memorable role as the inimitable Madea, a gun-toting granny who, amid the chaos of preparations for a family reunion, must try to keep her clan together in the face of various emotional crises. Based on Perry's acclaimed stage production, this hilarious and heartwarming comedy boasts an all-star cast, including Blair Underwood, Lynn Whitfield, Cicely Tyson, Rochelle Aytes and Maya Angelou.
link.title: synopsis
Diary of a Mad Black Woman
I Can Do Bad All By Myself
Diary of a Mad Black Woman: The Play
Tyler Perry's Madea Goes to Jail
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family: The Play
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Tyler Perry: What's Done in the Dark
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Tyler Perry's Why Did I Get Married Too?
Tae Guk Gi: The Brotherhood of War
Precious: Based on the Novel Push by Sapphire

link.synopsis: This dark comedy series finds unassuming housewife Cathy Jamison, recently estranged from her husband and now diagnosed with terminal cancer, deciding to finally live life on her own terms -- consequences be damned.
link.title: synopsis
The Book of Daniel: The Complete Series
Studio 60 on the Sunset Strip: The Complete Series

link.synopsis: The joke's on expert thief Cody Black (Kajuan Mitchell) when a band of thugs decides to break into his house while he's still in it -- but of course, he isn't laughing. For one thing, he can't call the cops because then he'll expose his own crimes. For another, his best friend (Adam Cardon) and girlfriend (Nichole Bunton) are trapped inside with him, and they're looking to him to set things right.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: Distraught over his drug-addicted girlfriend, Cody (Sarah Lind), who's overdosed and fallen into a coma, small-time dope peddler Art (Jay Baruchel) uses a time machine to journey into the past in a desperate gamble to change her future. But as his attempts repeatedly fail, he comes to realize that the only way to save Cody may be to sacrifice his love for her. David Ray directs this engaging romantic drama that also stars Jim Byrnes.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: When his best friend dies, professional gambler Adam Black (Stewart Granger) takes the man's orphaned daughter, Evalyne (Jean Simmons), as his ward. As years of boarding school make her a refined young woman, Adam finds himself attracted to her. But Evalyne's always believed he's her father, and following his heart means he must own up to his past. Edwin Styles co-stars in this breezy comedy, made as its two stars were about to wed in real life.
link.title: synopsis
The Beautiful Blonde from Bashful Bend
Anna and the King of Siam
I Was a Male War Bride

link.synopsis: In one night, childhood buddies Mark (Scott Grimes), Bobby (Jason London), Laith (Scott Michael Campbell) and Hutto (David DeLuise) discover how far they'll go for friendship in this award-winning dark comedy. When Mark reaches an emotional and professional dead zone, the others try to cheer him up. But what begins as a simple night out mushrooms into a madcap adventure to bust an animal porn ring and dispose of the body of a crystal meth dealer.
link.title: synopsis
He Died with a Felafel in His Hand
The Immaculate Conception of Little Dizzle
A Film with Me in It
How to Kill Your Neighbor's Dog

link.synopsis: All-star cameos spice up the comedy chaos in the movie debut of "Adult Swim" favorites Tim Heidecker and Eric Wareheim, who portray two numbskulls revamping a decrepit mall to repay the billion dollars they wasted while preparing their first film.
link.title: synopsis
Tim & Eric Awesome Show, Great Job!
Late Night with Conan O'Brien 10th Anniversary Special
Jay and Silent Bob Strike Back
Will Ferrell: You're Welcome, America: A Final Night with George W. Bush
I Now Pronounce You Chuck and Larry
Sex and the City: The Movie
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy

title.regular: Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie
title.short: Tim and Eric's Billion Dollar Movie

link.synopsis: In this Australian comedy based on David Stevens's stage play, Jeff (Russell Crowe) is a young gay man living with his widowed father, Harry (Jack Thompson). Although Harry has always accepted the fact that his son is openly gay, his acceptance is challenged. Jeff brings home a potential lover one night, and in turn, when Harry gets involved with Joyce, a divorcée he met through a dating service, she and Jeff can't see eye-to-eye.
link.title: synopsis

link.synopsis: George C. Scott stars in this black comedy as Herbert Bock, a suicidal doctor who struggles to find meaning in his life while a murderer stalks the halls of his hospital. Herbert's life is on a downward spiral, but just as he contemplates killing himself, patients at the hospital begin dying -- apparently from erroneous treatments they're being mysteriously ministered. Diana Rigg co-stars in this Academy Award winner for Best Screenplay.
link.title: synopsis

category.label: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee
category.term: Best Supporting Actress in a Motion Picture nominee

category.label: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee
category.term: Best Actor in a Motion Picture (Drama) nominee

link.title: The Murders in the Rue Morgue
The Man in the White Suit
The Taking of Pelham One Two Three
Agatha Christie's Evil Under the Sun
One Flew Over the Cuckoo's Nest
Orson Welles: The Stranger/Orson Welles on Film
How to Get Ahead in Advertising

link.synopsis: When the ornery patriarch of the Slocumb clan suddenly croaks, his dysfunctional extended family -- led by his stoic widow (Whoopi Goldberg) -- gathers to mourn his passing ... or at least that's what they're supposed to do. But a family closet overflowing with soured relationships and bitter feelings turns the funeral into a day full of bickering. LL Cool J is terrific as the son trying to come to grips with his feelings about his dad.
link.title: synopsis
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Tyler Perry's Madea's Big Happy Family
Tyler Perry's I Can Do Bad All by Myself
Sister Act 2: Back in the Habit
Austin Powers: The Spy Who Shagged Me
To Be or Not To Be
Tyler Perry's The Family That Preys

link.synopsis: What better way to impress one's stepfather than to jump Snake River Canyon on a moped? That's the premise of this over-the-top action comedy starring Andy Samberg of "Saturday Night Live," who also co-wrote the script. In a silly send-up of stuntman Evel Knievel's famously unsuccessful jump, Samberg plays an accident-prone daredevil who's determined to carry out the ridiculous feat at all costs. Will Arnett, Bill Hader and Isla Fisher co-star.
link.title: synopsis
Talladega Nights: The Ballad of Ricky Bobby
Aziz Ansari: Intimate Moments for a Sensual Evening
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son
Dumb and Dumberer: When Harry Met Lloyd

link.synopsis: Kevin Hart stars in this romantic comedy as a relationship expert whose thesis on love and dating has made him all the rage with single women. But despite his so-called expertise, the "relationship guru" struggles to keep his own marriage together.
link.title: synopsis
House Party 4: Down to the Last Minute
Did You Hear About the Morgans?
George Carlin: It's Bad for Ya
The Men Who Stare at Goats
Big Mommas: Like Father, Like Son

link.synopsis: Community college geology professors Dr. Ira Kane (David Duchovny) and Harry Block (Orlando Jones) make an unfathomable discovery: microscopic alien life-forms on a meteorite. The military, a government scientist (Julianne Moore) and others become involved as the microbes swell in size and number. But it's up to the professors to teach these monstrosities a lesson in director Ivan Reitman's goofy comedy.
link.title: synopsis
The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
The Day the Earth Stood Still
Freezer Burn: The Invasion of Laxdale
The Adventures of Buckaroo Banzai Across the 8th Dimension

link.synopsis: Join 12-year-old identical twins Zack and Cody (Dylan Sprouse and Cole Sprouse) for mischief galore in this quartet of episodes from their Disney Channel comedy series. When their mother lands a singing gig at the Tipton Hotel, the boys treat it like their personal playground -- much to the dismay of the Boston hotel's manager, Mr. Moseby (Phill Lewis). Ashley Tisdale is the gift-shop clerk who foils the twosome's shenanigans.
link.title: synopsis
Wizards of Waverly Place: The Movie
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody: Sweet Suite Victory
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody: Lip Synchin' in the Rain
The Suite Life on Deck: Anchors Away!
That's So Suite Life of Hannah Montana
Hannah Montana: Livin' the Rock Star Life
Wizards on Deck with Hannah Montana
Wizards of Waverly Place: Supernaturally Stylin'
Hannah Montana: Life's What You Make It
Cory in the House: All-Star Edition
Wizards of Waverly Place: Wizard School
Phineas and Ferb: The Fast and the Phineas
The Suite Life of Zack & Cody
The Naked Brothers Band: Polar Bears
Max & Ruby: Springtime for Max & Ruby
Max & Ruby: Party Time with Max & Ruby
Max & Ruby: Afternoons with Max & Ruby
Max & Ruby: A Visit with Grandma
The Backyardigans: It's Great to Be a Ghost
Mustard Pancakes: Are You Ready to Sing?

title.regular: The Suite Life of Zack & Cody: Taking Over the Tipton
title.short: Zack & Cody: Taking Over the Tipton

link.synopsis: Flamboyantly gay Austrian television reporter Bruno (Sacha Baron Cohen) stirs up trouble with unsuspecting guests and large crowds through brutally frank interviews and painfully hilarious public displays of homosexuality. An incredible chameleon who completely disappears behind his flaming alter ego, the bold Baron Cohen serves up nonstop laughs in this comedy by successfully rubbing people the wrong way.
link.title: synopsis
The Goods: Live Hard, Sell Hard
The 41-Year-Old Virgin Who Knocked Up Sarah Marshall and Felt Superbad About It
South Park: Bigger, Longer and Uncut
Artie Lange: It's the Whiskey Talkin'
Anchorman: The Legend of Ron Burgundy
Otto; or, Up With Dead People
The Mostly Unfabulous Social Life of Ethan Green

link.synopsis: Three real estate agents (Wendi McLendon-Covey, Ryan Smith and Bruce Thomas) with outrageous styles will do just about anything to close a deal, and that's exactly what happens when three quirky families set their sights on the same home. An official selection at the U.S. Comedy Arts Festival in Aspen, Colo., Armen Kaprelian's ensemble satire comedy co-stars April Barnett and Andrew Friedman.
link.title: synopsis
Glick Doesn't Do Red Carpet: Jiminy Glick at the Independent Spirit Awards

link.synopsis: When a bus filled with eight elderly women breaks down in the wilderness, the group of strangers is stranded at a deserted farmhouse with only their wits, their memories and eventually some roasted frogs' legs to sustain them. For several days, the women share their life stories and intimate thoughts. Director Cynthia Scott directs these nonprofessional actors delivering largely improvised dialogue to heartwarming effect.
link.title: synopsis
A Thousand Years of Good Prayers
Marilyn Hotchkiss Ballroom Dancing and Charm School
